a.span: Submit photos and videos for district social media use

li.a: District Mission, Goals, Core Beliefs & Learner-Centered Principles
Family Learning and Support for Home Network (FLASH)

img.div:
Where learning leads
to a lifetime of opportunities...

img.alt: CRS student with blue organizer box
MS student with bright blue braids
Three MS students learning about different types of fertilizer
High school dancers perform at CES
Group of CES friends on sitting on brightly colored rug
Two friends smiling at the HS
MS student with brightly colored folder
Two students working on their laptops at the HS
Two students at FRS with their lunchbags

div.title: Brooke Elnicky with Heart Hero Gavyn Rossi

div.a: CRS raises $22,750 for Kids Heart Challenge

br.span: Over the past 27 years, the school has raised an extraordinary total of more than $302,000 for the American Heart Association.

div.title: Principal Johnson and teacher Bethany Matsko with whipped cream pie on their faces

div.a: CES raises $19,020 for Kids Heart Challenge

br.span: Students celebrated reaching their goal this year with classic pie-in-the-face fun for several teachers, Assistant Principal Renee Mulrooney and Principal David Johnson.
Check out the latest issue of our community newsletter, The Link.

div.title: Three students building a water filter

br.span: Middle school earth science standards still include studying global resources like water, but teachers are finding ways to make learning more exciting, collaborative and hands-on.

div.a: Building community partnerships to benefit students

br.span: A connection was made with the Rochester chapter of the National Association of Women in Construction, whose members include architects, lawyers, tradespeople and contractors. They invited CES students to participate in NAWIC’s national Block Kids building competition.

div.title: Group of four students presenting their invention to others

div.a: Studying light and sound at FRS

br.span: Fairbanks Road School first-grade science teams used creativity and simple materials to build devices to communicate over long distances.

div.title: CTE student with CC MS student in automobile technology lab

div.a: MS students learn what CTE has to offer

br.span: Our seventh- and eighth-graders filled the halls at Monroe 2-Orleans BOCES’ WEMOCO building, visiting the Career and Technical Education classes to learn what the programs have to offer.

div.title: Students watching an online presentation from the Hall of Fame

div.a: Going the distance to open career doors

br.span: The world is full of exciting jobs, you just need to know where to look. Seventh-graders got a fun introduction to career discovery recently, via a virtual trip to the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

div.title: The team in Cleveland - group shot in front of Cavaliers mural

br.span: Our Saints boys varsity basketball team took an unforgettable trip to Cleveland in January.

div.title: Students from CRS shown on a big screen at CES

br.span: PE teachers at Churchville Elementary and Chestnut Ridge recently inaugurated a new cardiovascular endurance challenge for third- and fourth-graders: the C-C 500 relay.
Artwork by CCHS AP Studio Art students was on display at the Memorial Art Gallery's Inspired: Teen Show.

div.a: Four CCHS juniors selected for apprenticeship program

span.p: Congratulations to our students in the Engineering and Metal Fabrication Academy at CTE/WEMOCO. Over 100 students from around the region applied for the Finger Lakes Youth Apprenticeship Program; only 36 were signed.

div.a: C-C artists featured at RIT student art show

br.span: Many Churchville-Chili students were represented at the RIT Starts Here student art show. Ninth-grader Tristan Harris received the prestigious School of Film and Animation Visual Storytelling Award.

div.title: Group shot of MS Triple C award winners

br.span: Great job, everyone! The Triple C Awards are the highest honor we can give to students who challenge themselves to be their best every day.

div.title: Group shot of award winners from CRS

br.span: Congratulations to our latest stars from Chestnut Ridge Elementary School.

a.title: Children attend the Book Fair with their classes during the day. Location: CES back hallway

td.span: The Churchville-Chili Central School District challenges all students to strive for excellence while developing their unique talents and becoming respectful, resourceful citizens and contributing members of an interconnected global society.

div.span: From our 2019 Opening Day! Hear what students have to say about Churchville-Chili teachers and staff.

If you are unable to access anything on this site, please call our district office at 585-293-1800 extension 2300, so that we may provide you with an alternative.
